results.title: Born in the sun
results.creator_credit: John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the development of the dried fruits industry at Mildura from the time of Deakin’s irrigation bill, and highlights the part irrigation has played. Includes a dramatised extract of an Alfred Deakin speech. The film shows climatic setbacks which the industry has experienced. Illustrates the harvesting, processing and distribution of the fruit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Heyer and Australian National Film Board
results.description: Shows the development of the dried fruits industry at Mildura from the time of Deakin’s irrigation bill, and highlights the part irrigation has played. results.title: The Blowfly menace
results.creator_credit: A. C. McKay BVSc and Australian Wool Corporation
results.brief_description: For farmers and graziers this study of the life-cycle of the green blowfly and other flies associated with blowfly strike in sheep, and demonstrations of various methods of control, should prove both useful and interesting.

results.title: Before production begins
results.brief_description: The story of the birth of a new Holden car, from an artist’s conception, through the modelling of small and full scale models, to the making of the first prototype model. From the hundreds of scale drawings, skilled craftsmen create by hand, the hundreds of engine and body components of the prototype. Laboratory and road tests of components and the completed prototype ensue that every section of the car conforms to rigid engineering specifications. Only after all this preliminary work can mass production begin on a new model Holden car.

results.title: At the Land's End: the Wilson's Promontory National Park
results.creator_credit: David Swift, Wilson's Promontory Committee of Management, Parks Victoria and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: This film shows the breathtaking landscape, the wildlife and the facilities for holiday-makers at Tidal River. The work of the ranger is described and there are two outstanding sequences dealing with the Smoking Cliffs at Darby River and gannets diving off Five-Mile Beach. Narrated by Wynn Roberts.

results.title: As long as I can walk
results.brief_description: A report on a Moratorium March held in Melbourne in 1970. Interviews with marchers give insights into personal motives, and show the strong desire for a peaceful settlement of the Vietnam question.
results.description: A report on a Moratorium March held in Melbourne in 1970. Interviews with marchers give insights into personal motives, and show the strong desire for a peaceful settlement of the Vietnam question.

results.title: 11 Steps to Survival
results.creator_credit: Pierre L'Amare, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film demonstrating steps to take in the event of a nuclear attack. Animated drawings show the effects of atomic explosions in the air and at ground level. How wide an area is affected by light and heat flash, radiation and radio-active fall-out is clearly illustrated. How to build or improvise a fall-out shelter, what to stock in it, when to take shelter and how long to stay there are similarly explained.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pierre L’Amare, Robert Verrall and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: From Melville to Melbourne
results.creator_credit: Tristan Mungatopi, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Growing up in two worlds allows me to give back to my community. Tristan Mungatopi, a young Tiwi man’s search for identity and connection.

results.title: D-Day
results.creator_credit: Darryl Jordan, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Darryl Jordan and his partner prepare their home for the encroaching bushfires. The wait for D-day is all-consuming for this family. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: Community under siege
results.creator_credit: Suzanne Davies, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: In her role as a co-ordinator of the community centre, Suzanne Davies recounts the devastation that the Gippsland bushfires caused her community. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.

results.title: Dad's tools
results.creator_credit: Fred Atwell, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: There is a lot to do after a bushfire but Fred Atwell wants more than anything to find his dad’s cherished homemade tools. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Latrobe City and Arts Victoria.
